Posts.Content: Lorrae wrote: Hi hope everyone is well Had my mammogram done the results are.  There is no evidence of a solid or a cystic lesion on either side.  The breast tissue os reasonably symmetrical.  There is no abnormal calcification and no other abnormality has been identified.  There is no evidence of the abnormal ultrasound findings on this examination.  I went back to my GP and he said I was fine and should just have a follow up ultrasound in 3 months as the reason I was sent for a mammogram was that they found a 5mm mass on an ultrasound.  Can someone answer this question-:  How accurate is a mammogram? and Why would a lump show up on an ultrasound and not a mammogram.  I had a baby 12 weeks ago am 38 years old the people that did the mammogram looked at the films first before I left just in case they did not get a clear film. They said the films worked out fine.  Eventhough I am sure that I now probably have a lower chance of the lump being cancer cause no calcification showed up on the mammogram I still booked into a breast clinic on the 30th of October for another ultrasound and further investigation if needed.  My way of thinking is that in the slight possiblity it is something it would be quite treatable at 5mm and I would probably have a very good outcome. Once again ladies thank you.... Lorrae XX Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lump Not showing up on mammogram Lorrae Sillymommax4
